citation.article-title: Gemella asaccharolytica sp. nov., isolated from human clinical specimens
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Gemella asaccharolytica sp. nov.

Gemella asaccharolytica (a.sac′cha.ro.ly′ti.ca. Gr. pref. a- not; Gr. n. saccharon sugar; N.L. fem. adj. lytica from Gr. adj. lutikos able to lyse, able to loose; N.L. fem. adj. asaccharolytica not digesting sugar).
Cells stain Gram-variable and are non-motile cocci, approximately 0.5 μm in diameter.
Colonies on Brucella blood agar plates at 5 days are small, smooth, convex, circular, entire, semi-translucent, 0.4–0.5 mm in diameter and surrounded by a zone of greening (α-haemolysis).
Grows under strictly anaerobic conditions and after a number of subcultures in the presence of 2 and 6 % O2 and 5 % CO2.
Negative for catalase and oxidase activity, indole production and nitrate reduction.

Asaccharolytic; acid is not produced from glucose or the following other carbohydrates: adonitol, amygdalin, arabinose, cellobiose, erythritol, fructose, galactose, glycogen, inositol, inulin, lactose, maltose, mannitol, mannose, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, rhamnose, ribose, salicin, sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, xylose and xylan.
In PYG broth, moderate amounts of acetic acid and small amounts of lactic acid are produced.

Esterase lipase, esterase (weak), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, arginine arylamidase, proline arylamidase, leucyl glycine arylamidase, phenylalanine arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, tyrosine arylamidase, glycine arylamidase, histidine arylamidase, serine arylamidase and pyroglutamic acid arylamidase are produced.
Acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, alanyl-phenylalanyl-proline arylamidase, glycyl-tryptophan arylamidase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, urease and trypsin are not produced.
Aesculin, starch and gelatin are not hydrolysed.
Sensitive to vancomycin (5 μg), kanamycin (1000 μg) and SPS (1000 μg) and resistant to colistin sulfate (10 μg) special-potency identification discs. β-Lactamase-negative.
The type strain, WAL 1945JT (=ATCC BAA-1630T =CCUG 57045T), was isolated from a human wound infection.
Strains WAL 1822M and WAL 1990F are additional strains of the species.
